data.name: BasedOnAnswersMayBeAdditionalSteps
data.value:
Based on your answer to the last question, there may be:

  • more steps you should consider before filing a complaint with us
  • another complaint process that is better for your concerns

Please read the notice(s) below carefully before deciding whether to continue to file a complaint with us.

data.name: BasedOnAnswersTakeComplaintToDPA
data.value:
Based on your answer, we recommend that you make your complaint to the {0} provincial government instead of our office.

Usually, provincial privacy laws cover the handling of personal information by public bodies in Prince Edward Island.

What you can do

For more information or to file a complaint with the {0} provincial government, consult the Office of the {2}.

data.name: BasedOnAnswersUnlikelyCoveredByPIPEDA
data.value:
Based on your answers it is very unlikely that the Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (PIPEDA) covers your complaint.

Usually, provincial privacy laws cover the handling of personal information by public bodies or health information custodians in {0}.

What you can do

For more information or to file a complaint to the {0} provincial government, consult:

  • with the {2}
  • provincial legislation deemed substantially similar to PIPEDA

data.name: BasedOnAnswersUnlikelyCoveredByPIPEDAList
data.value:
Based on your answers it is very unlikely that the Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (PIPEDA) covers your complaint.

Usually PIPEDA applies to the handling of employees’ personal information only if the organization is defined as a “federal work, undertaking or business”. Examples may include:

  • airports, aircrafts or airlines
  • banks
  • inter-provincial or international transportation by land or water
  • telecommunications
  • offshore drilling operations
  • radio and television broadcasting

What you can do

Depending on your concern, there may be help available at the provincial or territorial level. If your concerns relates to wrongful termination, denied benefits, workplace harassment or unfair discipline, you can seek information from authorities dealing with:

  • employment equity and human rights
  • employment standards
  • workplace health and safety regulations

We also encourage you to consider raising your concern with the person responsible for privacy at your organization, often called the Privacy Officer.

data.name: BeforeContinuingWithComplaintPleaseReview
data.value:
Under the Personal Information Protection and Electronic Document Act (PIPEDA), individuals have a right to access their personal information that is held by an organization.

Before continuing with your complaint, please review the information below.

How to make an access request to an organization

You need to do the following to exercise your right to access your personal information held by an organization:

  • Make your access request in writing to the organization
  • Provide enough details about your identity and what you are seeking to allow the organization to find your information
    • Your request must be only for your own personal information
    • For details on the right of access for executors of a will, beneficiaries and representatives consult: Guidance on managing Family Member/Household Accounts
  • Allow a minimum of 30 days for the organization to respond

If your access request is time-sensitive, we strongly encourage you to make your access request separately from any other requests you are making to the organization. Also, you should narrow your access request as much as possible (for example by a period of time, or a specific type of document). For more details on making an access request, consult: How to access your personal information held by businesses .

If you are not satisfied with the response, follow up with the organization directly, to explain what is missing, and give an opportunity for response.

If you make a complaint to our office, it must be done within 6 months of being denied access to your information.

How the organization must respond to your request

An organization subject to PIPEDA has the following obligations after it receives an access request:

  • It must respond to your request within 30 days, or, within 60 days if it informs you in advance that more time is needed.
  • It must give you access to your own personal information. An organization is not required to give access to information which is not your personal information. For example:
    • the names of particular employees (such as ones you interacted with, or who accessed your personal information)
    • information relating to someone who fraudulently impersonated you (such as recordings of the person, details of when and how the fraud took place or how it was detected)
    • voiceprints or images of other people (such as in recordings of calls or on surveillance video)
    • information about an organization's business decision-making processes or other internal processes
  • It must give you access at little or no cost. Organizations are not required to provide access in the form you prefer. For example, organizations may invite you to review the information on their premises instead of making copies, or may provide a transcript of a call, not a recording.
  • It must apply any exemptions to the right of access appropriately. Organizations are allowed by law to withhold certain personal information. For example, organizations may withhold personal information that was collected to investigate a breach of an agreement or a violation of a law (if the person’s knowledge of or consent for the collection would harm the investigation).
What you need to file a complaint with us if you are still dissatisfied

To make a complaint to us about an organization’s handling of your access request, you will need these documents and information:

  • a copy of your written request to the organization
  • the date you sent the request
  • the exact address (postal or email) you sent your request to
  • a copy of any response to your request from the organization

If the organization provided a set of documents in response to your request, you do not need to include all of them. However, please attach any cover letter or emails from the organization, and any parts of the response that you are concerned about.

Without these documents and information, we will not be able to process your file.

data.name: BeforeFilingAComplaintAddressYourConcernsDirectly
data.value: Before filing a complaint with our office, we encourage you first to attempt to address your concerns directly with the institution. Many times you can resolve privacy issues through direct communication with the Access to Information and Privacy (ATIP) Coordinator. To find this person, please consult the list of Access to Information and Privacy Coordinators by institution.

data.name: BeforeFilingAComplaintWithOurOfficeWeEncourageToAddressDirectlyWithOrganization
data.value: Before filing a complaint with our office, we encourage you to try addressing your concerns directly with the organisation. Often you can resolve privacy concerns by writing to or speaking with the organization’s privacy contact.

data.name: CannotProcessComplaintUntilAllInfoReceived
data.value: We cannot process a complaint until all relevant information is received. All supporting documents must be received within 45 days or no further action will be taken.

data.name: CanOnlyFileOnBehalfWithPermission
data.value:
You may only file a complaint on behalf of someone else if you are authorized to do so. Please use our representative authorization form:


Authorization to act as a representative for a privacy complaint (PDF, 99 KB)

You must submit the completed form signed by the complainant as an attachment to your complaint.

We will not be able to process the complaint without the completed signed authorization form.

data.name: City
data.value: City

data.name: ClarificationOfOPCRole
data.value:
Note that our Commissioner does not have the power to force a government institution to take a specific action.

The Commissioner makes findings and recommendations and works with institutions to improve their management of personal information.

Our office does not have the power to fine institutions or seek damages for complaints. Also, we do not address criminal or civil culpability.

data.name: ContinuingWithComplaintText
data.value: If you wish to continue your complaint with us, please do not file a complaint about the same matter with another organization at the same time. Usually, our office will not investigate your complaint until after you have tried other available ways to resolve your concern. Also, we will not investigate complaints that are outside our jurisdiction.

data.name: HandlingOfPersonalInfoMayBeProvincial
data.value: Handling of personal information in {0} may fall under provincial privacy laws instead of the Personal Information Protection and Electronic Document Act (PIPEDA). To help us determine jurisdiction, please answer the questions below.

data.name: HaveYouSubmittedBefore
data.value: Have you submitted a complaint in the past with the Office of the Privacy Commissioner?

data.name: IfComplaintAgainstMoreThanOneInstitution
data.value:
• If the relevant institution is not listed, it may be covered by private sector or provincial privacy legislation. To find out where to address an issue covered by another privacy law, refer to the summary of privacy laws in Canada.
  • If after consulting this page you are still unsure of the institution, please contact OPC's Information Center.
  • After submitting the complaint, you will have the opportunity to file a different privacy complaint about the same institution or file the same type of complaint about another institution without having to re-enter all your information.

data.name: IfNotSureTellWhereYouLive
data.value: If you're not sure, please tell us where you live.

data.name: IfYouChooseToContactInstitution
data.value: If, based on any of the information above, you’re not sure if you want to continue with your complaint now, you can end your session and return to file a complaint later.

data.name: IfYouHaveMoreThanOneReasonToComplain
data.value: If you have more than one privacy complaint to file about this institution, you will have the opportunity to do so, later in this form

data.name: IfYouHaveNotTakenAllNecessaryStepsBeAware
data.value: If you have not taken all the necessary steps, please be aware that we may decline to investigate your complaint. If you wish to continue your complaint, you will need to attach copies of your correspondence with the organization at the end of this form

data.name: IfYouRaisedConcernWithOrganizationWhyFileWithUs
data.value: If you have raised your concern with the organization’s contact for privacy issues, and you still have any of the following concerns, please click on any relevant choices below for further information.

data.name: IfYouWishToContactAnotherBody
data.value: If, based on any of the information above, you’re not sure if you want to continue with your complaint now, you can end your session and return to file a complaint later.

data.name: IfYouWishToContinueWithoutHavingRaisedConcerns
data.value: If you wish to continue your complaint without having raised your concerns with the organization, please be aware that we may decline to investigate your complaint.

data.name: IfYouWishToContinueYouWillNeedToAttachCopies
data.value: If you wish to continue your complaint, you will need to attach copies of your correspondence with the organization about your privacy concern at the end of this form.

data.name: ImportantToShowWhatYouHaveDoneToAddressYourConcerns
data.value:
It is important to show what you have done to address your concerns with the organization involved.

Usually, our office will not investigate your complaint until after you have tried other available ways to resolve your concern.

data.name: InformalRequestFirstInfo
data.value:
Under the Privacy Act, you must make a formal request to the institution and give the institution an opportunity to respond before making a complaint to our office. Please contact the Access to Information and Privacy Coordinator at the institution. To find this person, please consult the list of Access to Information and Privacy Coordinators by institution.

If, based on the above, you’re not sure if you want to continue with your complaint now, you can end your session and return to file a complaint later.

data.name: InformationProtectedInThisForm
data.value: The information you provide on this form is protected under the Access to Information Act and the Privacy Act. For more information, please refer to the Office of the Privacy Commissioner of Canada’s Privacy Policy.

data.name: InfoSubmittedWillReviewAndContact
data.value: Your information has been submitted. We will review your information and will follow-up as appropriate.

data.name: InProgress
data.value: In Progress

data.name: InstitutionAgreedRequestOnInformalBasis
data.value: Did the institution agree to process your request on an informal basis?

data.name: InstitutionsHave30DaysToRepond
data.value:
Under the Privacy Act institutions have thirty (30) days after your request is received to respond. Institutions may seek, with a reason set out in the Act, an extension of a further thirty (30) days to respond.

If, based on the above, you’re not sure if you want to continue with your complaint now, you can end your session and return to file a complaint later.

data.name: Organization
data.value: Organization

data.name: OrganizationsMustHaveProcessesToRespondToComlaintsAndQuestions
data.value:
Organizations must have processes to respond to complaints and questions about their handling of personal information, as set out in the Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (PIPEDA). Usually organizations will have a different contact for privacy (often called the privacy officer), than for general customer service or other complaints.

If you have not raised your issue in writing with this contact, we strongly encourage you to do so before filing a complaint with us. In almost all cases, we are able to investigate only if you have already taken this step.

data.name: Other
data.value: Other

data.name: OverviewPA
data.value:
Complete this form to submit a privacy complaint about a federal institution to the Office of the Privacy Commissioner of Canada.

Use this form if your complaint pertains to your personal information or when you believe that a federal government institution has mishandled personal information

Under the Privacy Act, personal information is defined as any recorded information about an identifiable individual. This can include information such as:

  • individual’s age
  • marital status
  • medical or employment history
  • information on financial transactions
  • identifying number assigned to an individual
  • opinions about an individual made by others

Instructions

If your complaint is about a request for information that is not personal information, you may wish to contact the Office of the Information Commissioner of Canada (OIC)

Filling out the form

  • Fill out the 3 sections of the form:
    • Part A: Preliminary information, which asks questions to help us determine if we have jurisdiction under the Privacy Act to address your concern
    • Part B: Steps taken, which asks what you have done so far to try to resolve your concern
    • Part C: Details and documents, which asks for details of your concern and supporting documentation (such as copies of correspondence with the institution's Access to Information and Privacy Coordinator)
  • You can check your progress at the bottom of each screen
  • Use the “Previous screen” navigation button instead of your browser's "back" button
  • Your session will expire after 2 hours of inactivity
  • Review and edit your information after filling out the 3 sections
  • Review your complaint before submitting it
  • After submitting the complaint, you may download or print a copy

Your information is not saved until you complete the final “Submit complaint” step. If you end your session before submitting, your information will be deleted. You will have to start over.

data.name: OverviewPIPEDA
data.value:
Complete this online form to submit a privacy complaint about a business to the Office of the Privacy Commissioner of Canada.

Filing out form

  • Fill in the 3 sections of the form:
    • Part A: Jurisdiction, which asks questions to help us determine if we have jurisdiction, under the Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (PIPEDA) to address your concern
    • Part B: Steps taken, which asks what you have done so far to try to resolve your concern
    • Part C: Details and documents, which asks for details of your concern and supporting documents (like copies of correspondence with the organization’s privacy officer)
  • You can check your progress at the bottom of each screen
  • Use the “Previous screen” navigation button instead of your browser's "back" button
  • Your session will expire after 2 hours of inactivity
  • Review and edit your complaint before submitting it
  • After submitting the complaint, you may download or print a copy

Your information is not saved until you complete the final “Submit complaint” step. If you end your session before submitting, the information will be deleted. You will have to start over.

data.name: ReasonForNotRaisingConcernContent
data.value:
Don’t think it will help

Before filing a complaint with our office, we encourage you first to attempt to address your concerns directly with the institution. Many times you can resolve privacy issues through direct communication with the Access to Information and Privacy (ATIP) Coordinator. To find this person, please consult the list of Access to Information and Privacy Coordinators by institution

Can’t find the contact

Please consult the list of Access to Information and Privacy Coordinators by institution.

Wish to stay anonymous

Please note that your name (except in extraordinary circumstances) and the details of your complaint will be shared with the institution that is the subject of the complaint.

We may, for the purpose of the investigation, share personal information with the institution and may collect personal information from that institution.

We do not otherwise disclose the information you provide unless such a disclosure is in accordance with the subsection 8(2) of the Privacy Act, which is reserved for limited situations. In the case of such a disclosure, we will only disclose the information that is required and, wherever possible, will inform you.

The personal information you provide on our complaint form is protected under the Access to Information Act and the Privacy Act.

If you wish to just tell us about an issue, and not have your identity revealed, use our online form to share a privacy comment or an issue without filing a formal complaint. At our Commissioner’s discretion, we can look into matters without a person making a complaint.

data.name: ReasonForNotRaisingConcernHeader

data.name: SendingDocumentsByMailContent
data.value:
If you send your supporting documents by mail, please include the reference number that you will get when you submit this online complaint form.

We cannot process a complaint until all relevant information is received. If we do not receive the supporting documents within 45 days, no further action will be taken.

  • the who, what, when, where, why of your complaint
  • If applicable, please indicate any file or reference number that was assigned to your request (these numbers typically look like this: P-2018-12345)

data.name: TypeOfPersonalInfoMayAffectIfCoveredByPIPEDA
data.value: The type of personal information involved may affect whether the Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (PIPEDA) applies to your complaint. Please answer the question below to help us determine jurisdiction.

data.name: UnderPIPEDAOrganizationsAreRequired
data.value:
Not sure if the organization has a privacy officer, or how to find that person

Organizations subject to PIPEDA must have a process for handling people’s privacy concerns. Usually there is a different contact for privacy than for general customer service or other complaints. To find this contact, we suggest looking in the footer of the organization's website where many organizations post a "privacy policy". Contact information is usually near the bottom of the policy. If this does not help, you can write to the senior management or legal department (legal contact information can often be found in an organization's terms and conditions). Address your letter or email: "To the attention of the Privacy Officer."

Not sure the organization will pay attention to you

Organizations subject to PIPEDA must have a process to handle people’s privacy concerns. Raising your issue with the organization will often lead to resolving it, even if you have had past issues or the issue is broad and affects more than just one person. You can read our tips on how to write an effective letter/email to a privacy officer. Even if written communication does not resolve your concerns, it could be useful during the complaint process with our office.

Already spoken to them verbally

A clearly-worded written request or complaint can be effective where verbal discussions have not been. Putting your concerns in writing reduces the risk of miscommunications, and creates a record of your attempts. You can read our tips on how to write an effective letter/email to a privacy officer. If written communication does not resolve your issue, it will still create a strong starting point for a complaint to our office.

Wish to stay anonymous

Please note that your name (except in extraordinary circumstances) and the details of your complaint will be shared with the organization that is the subject of the complaint.

We may, for the purpose of the investigation, share personal information with the organization and may collect personal information from that organization.

We do not otherwise disclose the information you provide unless such a disclosure is in accordance with the subsection 8(2) of the Privacy Act, which is reserved for limited situations. In the case of such a disclosure, we will only disclose the information that is required and, wherever possible, will inform you.

The personal information you provide on our complaint form is protected under the Access to Information Act and the Privacy Act.

If you wish to just tell us about an issue, and not have your identity revealed, use our online form to share a privacy comment or an issue without filing a formal complaint. At our Commissioner’s discretion, we can look into matters without a person making a complaint.

Think that our office is best positioned to consider the issue

If you wish to just tell us about your concerns without writing to the organization, you can use our online form to share a privacy comment or an issue without filing a formal complaint. At our Commissioner’s discretion, we can look into matters without a person making a complaint.

data.name: Upload
data.value: Upload

data.name: UploadFileToComplaint
data.value: Upload a file to attach to your complaint

data.name: UploadingSupportingDocumentsContent
data.value:
We accept the following file types: doc, docx, xls, xlsx, ppt, pptx, wpd, csv, pdf, jpg, jpeg, gif, txt, rtf, tif, and tiff.

We cannot process a complaint submission until all relevant information is received. You can upload files up to a total of 25 MB.

data.name: UploadingSupportingDocumentsHeader
data.value: Uploading supporting documents

data.name: UploadRepresentativeForm
data.value: Upload the representative authorization form signed by the complainant.

data.name: UseOfContactInformationAlert
data.value:
Use of contact information

Please note that OPC may use any of the contact information you have provided to contact you or your representative about your complaint. Please note that all methods of communication involve some risk that information may be misdirected or intercepted and manipulated. When communicating with you about personal information, we will take appropriate security measures following the Policy on Government Security.

data.name: UsuallyOurOfficeDoesNotInvestigateIf
data.value:
Usually, our office does not investigate if:

  • a matter could be better dealt with, either initially or completely, by other means provided for under federal or provincial law
  • a complainant has not first tried all grievance or review processes that are reasonably available
  • a complainant did not file a complaint with us within a reasonable period

data.name: WeMayNotBeAbleToInvestigateComplaint
data.value: We may not be able to investigate your complaint.

data.name: WhatDateRequestWasSent
data.value: What date did you send your written access request to the organization? If you sent multiple requests, please list each one. (maximum 5,000 characters)

data.name: WhatDateRequestWasSentShort
data.value: What date did you send your written access request to the organization?

data.name: WhatDidOrganizationDoOrDidNotDo
data.value: what the organization did, or didn't do, with personal information that you are unhappy about.

data.name: WhatIsReasonForNotRaisingYourConcern

data.name: WhatWouldResolveYourComplaintDetailsPA
data.value: What would resolve your concerns? (maximum 5,000 characters)

data.name: WhatWouldResolveYourComplaintDetailsPIPEDA
data.value: What would resolve your concerns? (maximum 5,000 characters)

data.name: WhatWouldResolveYourComplaintPaExample
data.value:
Please describe any steps or remedies that would resolve your concerns. For example:

  • for an employee to receive training
  • a change in a practice
  • getting a specific piece of information

Please note our Office does not have the power to fine organizations or award damages

data.name: WhatWouldResolveYourComplaintShort
data.value: What would resolve your complaint for you? (maximum 5,000 characters)

data.name: WhichOrganizationIsComplaint
data.value: Which organization is your complaint against? (maximum 5,000 characters)

data.name: WhyWasInstitutionResponseUnsatisfactoryContent
data.value:
The institution has not responded.

Please allow some time for the institution to respond and resolve your issue before filing a complaint with us. Usually, it is reasonable to allow 3 to 5 weeks.

The institution has not made the changes you asked for or given you the information you are looking for.

Please be sure to check that your correspondence with the institution was clear about the exact changes or information you are seeking. Consider making a final summary of your concerns and what you are seeking in case the institution did not fully understand.

The institution has not compensated you for what happened.

Please be aware that our office does not have the power to order compensation. Usually, people need to take legal action to pursue compensation. You may wish to consult a lawyer for more information.

The employee(s) responsible for what happened have not been held accountable.

Generally, an institution is accountable for how its employees handle personal information. This could mean taking steps to prevent a similar problem in the future. The institution might change its systems, processes and training, or discipline the employee. The decision to discipline an employee is complex and must be made carefully by the institution. Our office cannot order disciplinary action.

Also, the Privacy Act does not give complainants the right to know if an employee was disciplined and institutions will not usually release this information.

data.name: WhyWasInstitutionResponseUnsatisfactoryHeader
data.value: If you have already raised your privacy concern with the institution, and you still have any of the following concerns, please click on any relevant choices below for further information.

data.name: WhyWasInstitutionResponseUnsatisfactoryIfYouWishToContinue
data.value: If you wish to continue your complaint, you will need to attach copies of your correspondence with the institution (if any) about your privacy concern at the end of this form.

data.name: WhyWasOrganizationResponseUnsatisfactoryContent
data.value:
The organization has not responded.

Please allow some time for the organization to respond and resolve your issue before filing a complaint with us. Usually, it is reasonable to allow 3 to 5 weeks.

The organization has not made the changes you asked for or given you the information you are looking for.

Please be sure to check that your correspondence with the organization was clear about the exact changes or information you were seeking. Consider making a final summary of your concerns and what you are seeking in case the organization did not fully understand.

The organization has not compensated you for what happened.

Please be aware that our office does not have the power to order compensation. Usually, people need to take legal action to pursue compensation. You may wish to consult a lawyer for more information.

The employee(s) responsible for what happened have not been held accountable.

Generally, an organization is accountable for how its employees handle personal information. This could mean taking steps to prevent a similar problem in the future. The organization might change its systems, processes and training, or discipline the employee. The decision to discipline an employee is complex and must be made carefully by the institution. Our office cannot order disciplinary action.

Also, the Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (PIPEDA) does not give complainants the right to know if an employee was disciplined and organizations will not usually release this information.

data.name: YourComplaintHasBeenSentPA
data.value:
Please keep this email for future reference

Your complaint to the Office of the Privacy Commissioner of Canada has been successfully submitted. Your reference number is {0}.

Responding to concerns from individuals with respect to their privacy rights is a key priority for the OPC. Please be assured that we will review the information you provided and contact you if we need any further information. We aim to contact individuals within 30 business days.

If you have further information or documents to provide now, or in future, please upload them using our Document Drop-off or send them by mail to:

  • Reference: {0}
  • Intake Office
  • Office of the Privacy Commissioner of Canada
  • 30 Victoria Street
  • Gatineau, Québec
  • K1A 1H3

For more information on our investigation process, you can consult our publication: What to expect during a complaint investigation under the Privacy Act.

data.name: YourComplaintHasBeenSentPIPEDA
data.value:

Responding to concerns from individuals with respect to their privacy rights is a key priority for the OPC. Please be assured that we will review the information you provided and contact you if we need any further information. We aim to contact individuals within 30 business days.

If you have further information or documents to provide now, or in future, please upload them using our Document Drop-off or send them by mail to:

  • Reference: {0}
  • Intake Office
  • Office of the Privacy Commissioner of Canada
  • 30 Victoria Street
  • Gatineau, Québec
  • K1A 1H3

For more information on our investigation process, you can consult our publication: What to expect during a complaint investigation under the Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act.

data.value: Your session has ended-Privacy complaint form

data.name: YourSessionHasEndedText
data.value: Your session has just ended. If you wish to file a privacy complaint later, you will need to access the form again and start over.

data.name: YourSessionHasEndedTitleBusiness
data.value: Your session has ended—Privacy complaint form (private sector organization)

data.name: YourSessionHasEndedTitleFederal

data.name: YouShouldAttachTheFollowingToComplaint
data.value: Based on your responses so far, you should attach the following documents with your complaint:

data.name: YouWillNeedToProvideCopiesOfYourCorrespondence
data.value: You are now getting to the section of the complaint form where you will need to provide details about your complaint. Please be aware that you will need to provide copies of your correspondence with the organization about your privacy concern as well as any documents related to a complaint filed with another body. We recommend you have them ready before continuing.

data.name: YouWillNeedToRegisterAgain
data.value: (you will need to register again to file a different type of complaint about another institution)

data.name: NoteYouWillBeAskedToAttachCopiesPa
data.value: Note that you will be asked to attach copies of any related correspondence with the organization about your privacy concerns.

data.name: NoteYouWillBeAskedToAttachDocumentsCorrespondenceCopiesPipeda
data.value: Please note that you will be asked to attach copies of any related correspondence with the organization about your privacy concerns

data.name: NoteYouWillBeAskedToAttachDocumentsRelatedCopiesPipeda
data.value: Please note that you will be asked to attach supporting documents relating to this complaint (and its outcome, if completed).

data.name: PleaseNoteOfficeNoPowerForFine
data.value: Please note our Office does not have the power for fine organizations or award damages.

data.name: FileAnotherComplaintPipeda
data.value: • File a privacy complaint about a business (you will need to register again to file a different type of complaint about another business)

data.name: RelatedContentPipeda
data.value:
• Guide to the PIPEDA complaint process
  • Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (PIPEDA)
  • Businesses and your personal information
  • Tips for raising your privacy concern with a business

data.name: SupplementaryInfoAddedPA
data.value:
Your submission to the Office of the Privacy Commissioner of Canada related to reference number: {0} has been successfully submitted.

We will review your submission and contact you if we need further information.

For more information on our investigation process, you can consult our publication: What to expect during a complaint investigation under the Privacy Act.

data.name: SupplementaryInfoAddedPIPEDA
data.value:
Your submission to the Office of the Privacy Commissioner of Canada related to reference number: {0} has been successfully submitted.

We will review your submission and contact you if we need further information.

For more information on our investigation process, you can consult our publication: What to expect during a complaint investigation under the Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act.

data.name: WhichOrganizationIsComplaintShort
data.value: Which organization is your complaint against?

data.name: PartC_Section3DetailsForDescriptionOfConcernsTitleFederal
data.value: Part C: Details (description of concerns)—Privacy complaint form (federal institution)

data.name: SummarizedConcernsSample
data.value:
Please explain:

  • what the organization did or did not do, with personal information, that you are unhappy about
  • the who, what, when, where, why of your complaint
  • If applicable, please indicate any file or reference number that was assigned to your correspondence with the institution about these concerns

data.name: SummarizeYourConcernsAndAnyStepsTaken
data.value: You indicated that in addition to concerns about your access request, you have other concerns. Please summarize these concerns.

data.name: InstructionsTextRepresentative
data.value: Please put the complainant's information in the Complainant section below, and your information as their representative in the Representative section below.

data.name: InstructionsTextTitle
data.value: Instructions

data.name: PartA_ComplaintAgainstOpcQ2_1Title
data.value: Part A: Preliminary information (Complaint against OPC)—Privacy complaint form (federal institution)

data.name: PartA_ComplaintAgainstOpcYouSelected
data.value:
You selected that your privacy complaint is against the Office of the Privacy Commissioner of Canada (OPC). If your complaint is not against the OPC, please use the “previous” button below to return to the previous screen and make a different selection.

If your complaint is against the OPC, i.e. if your concern is that the OPC itself has mishandled personal information, please be aware that you cannot make a complaint against the OPC under the Privacy Act using this form. Instead, we invite you to submit your complaint to the Ad Hoc Privacy Commissioner appointed to investigate complaints against the OPC under the Privacy Act.

data.name: PartA_ComplaintAgainstOpc_WhatYouCanDo
data.value:
What you can do

You can write to the Ad Hoc Privacy Commissioner for more information or to file a complaint.

data.name: TypeOfPersonalInfoMayAffectIfCoveredByPIPEDAPlural
data.value: The type of personal information involved may affect whether the Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (PIPEDA) applies to your complaint. Please answer the questions below to help us determine jurisdiction.

data.name: InformationDoesNotMatchExistingComplaint
data.value: The information you have provided does not belong to an existing complaint, please try again. If your second try does not succeed, you will be asked to start the process again

data.name: ReferenceNumberFormatInvalid
data.value: The reference number you have provided does not match the reference number format
